word.definition: In or to what place or position.
word.name: where
word.origin: Origin Old English hwÇ£r, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch waar and German wo.

word.definition: What or which person or people.
word.name: who

word.definition: A man in relation to his child or children.
word.name: father

word.definition: A pear-shaped fruit with a rough leathery skin and smooth, oily edible flesh.
word.name: avocado

word.definition: A woman in relation to a child or children to whom she has given birth.
word.name: mother

word.definition: A man or boy in relation to other sons and daughters of his parents.
word.name: brother

word.definition: A woman or girl in relation to other daughters and sons of her parents.
word.name: sister

word.definition: An instrument composed of a blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon.
word.name: knife

word.definition: The goods or merchandise kept on the premises of a shop or warehouse and available for sale or distribution.
word.name: stock

word.definition: A small rodent that typically has a pointed snout, relatively large ears and eyes, and a long tail.
word.name: mouse

word.definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced.
word.name: this

word.definition: An implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food.
word.name: spoon

word.definition: A small rodent that typically has a pointed snout, relatively large ears and eyes, and a long tail.
word.name: mouse

word.name: mouse
